content.description:
The wall forms a 90-degree corner. The route is the closest to the corner.

The first bolt is high, but there is a safer option to reach it using the crack in the corner. It is hard to rate it, since most of the moves in 5.7-5.9 range but the top flaps. They can be climbed around using the corner features.

The rock feels untouched, rough, some loose rocks and spider webs.
content.location: The right side of the wall forms a 90-degree corner. The route is the closest to the corner.

content.description:
This route climbs the obvious large crack in the corner dihedral. The stone on the right side of the dihedral tends to be softer and more apt to breaking.

Unless you are really jonesing to trad climb I would avoid this...
content.protection: Bring lots of big pro, doubles on #3, 4, 5 and a 6. There are no anchors up top.
content.location: This is climbers left of Unnamed and Nutter Butter both sport climbs. There are several loose rocks in this crack, a few of which were removed during the FA. Lower either by rapping off a tree up top or traversing to the anchors of Unnamed.
